bug.short_desc: Create a Custom Script to find the Revison Number of a Contrib at Sourceforge

long_desc.thetext:
This is a follow-up bug on bug#3769, which addressed a change in Sourceforge's ViewVC HTML; this affected the parsing of the HTML, to derive the revision number of a contrib. Create a custom, server-based script that works as an interface for querying the latest revision of a contrib, rather than going directly to the Sourceforge web site.
This would provide a more robust interface, which could remain stable across qooxdoo versions, independent of the Sourceforge ViewVC HTML changing or not. With the change addressed in bug#3769 we can fix the current development branches, but what about older qooxdoo versions? They just break, and users can only apply a patch by hand.

I'm closing this as WONTFIX, as with Contrib 2.0 the relevance of the SourceForge SVN repo is declining. Contrib 2.0 will use other means for freshness checking. If we run in this issue again while still using SF we can reopen.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
